definition: to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: We filed out to the accompaniment of the organ.
sentences.chinese: 我们在管风琴伴奏下鱼贯而出。

sentences.english: Shortly after, he also became organist at nearby St. Nicholas's.
sentences.chinese: 不久，他又成为管风琴在附近的圣尼古拉斯的。

sentences.english: He also held a position as private organist to the Earl of Donegal.
sentences.chinese: 他还举行了一次私人管风琴的多尼戈尔伯爵的地位。
是一架很漂亮的管风琴。

sentences.english: Electronic organs are much smaller and cheaper than pipe organs.
sentences.chinese: 电子琴要比管风琴小得多，也便宜得多。

sentences.english: He remained a renowned organist throughout his life.
sentences.chinese: 他仍然是一个一生著名管风琴。

sentences.english: A pipe organ gives much more volume than a violin or flute.
sentences.chinese: 管风琴发出的音量比小提琴或笛子都大。

sentences.english: Unchurched Harry hates organs and choirs.
sentences.chinese: “哈利”可能不喜欢管风琴和唱诗班。

sentences.english: Yeah I still play the organ, but not the service, just for myself.
sentences.chinese: 她就是天涯《闲闲书话》里的管风琴斑竹。

sentences.english: Organ Music For more information, visit …
sentences.chinese: 王燕基演奏的传统管风琴音乐。

definition: to perform on a musical instrument
